description: Azure cloud services designed for U.S. government agencies and partners, with dedicated regions and enhanced compliance

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides Azure AD, Azure RBAC, and network security groups for access control
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures RBAC roles, network rules, and manages user access to resources
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Azure RBAC for resource access, implement network security groups, use Azure AD Conditional Access

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides network isolation, VNets, and ExpressRoute for controlled connectivity
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures VNet peering, ExpressRoute, and firewall rules for external connections
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Azure Firewall, configure NSG rules, implement ExpressRoute for dedicated connections

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure generates platform audit logs via Azure Monitor and Activity Logs
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables diagnostic logging, configures log retention, and exports to Log Analytics or SIEM
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Azure Monitor, configure diagnostic settings for all resources, set retention policies

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure protects platform audit logs with encryption and access controls
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer protects custom audit logs and Log Analytics workspace with RBAC
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Log Analytics workspace with RBAC, enable immutable storage for critical logs

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure maintains secure baseline configurations for platform services
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer establishes and maintains configuration baselines for deployed resources
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Azure Policy to enforce configuration baselines, leverage Azure Blueprints

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides security configuration capabilities via Azure Policy and Security Center
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures and enforces security settings for deployed resources
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud recommendations, implement Azure Policy for security settings

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures resources to provide only essential capabilities
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Disable unused services, remove unnecessary packages from VMs, use minimal base images

control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer restricts and monitors use of nonessential programs
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use application allowlisting, implement Just-in-Time VM access, monitor for unauthorized software

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure uses FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic modules for authentication
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: No customer action required - inherent in Azure Government

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides incident detection via Microsoft Defender for Cloud
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements incident response procedures and uses Azure tools for detection/response
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Use Microsoft Sentinel for SIEM/SOAR, configure Defender for Cloud alerts, establish IR procedures

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure implements network boundary protection for infrastructure
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer implements boundary protection via VNets, NSGs, and Azure Firewall
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Segment networks using VNets and subnets, deploy Azure Firewall, use NSGs for micro-segmentation

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure enforces TLS 1.2+ for management plane connections
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer configures TLS for application communications and data plane
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure TLS 1.2+ for application gateways, disable older protocols, use Azure Key Vault for certificates

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides encryption capabilities using FIPS 140-2 validated modules
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables and configures encryption for data at rest and in transit
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Azure Disk Encryption, use Azure Storage Service Encryption, configure database TDE

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides platform-level encryption for data at rest
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables encryption for storage accounts, managed disks, and databases
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Azure Disk Encryption for VMs, use Storage Service Encryption, enable SQL TDE
evidence_artifacts: Encryption status for all storage resources

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure patches platform services and infrastructure
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer patches VMs, containers, and custom applications using Azure Update Management
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Update Management for VMs, configure automatic updates, monitor patching compliance

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure provides Microsoft Defender for Cloud with malware protection capabilities
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer enables and configures anti-malware for VMs and workloads
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Enable Microsoft Defender for Servers, deploy anti-malware extensions to VMs, configure real-time protection

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure automatically updates platform-level malware protection
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer ensures anti-malware definitions are updated on VMs
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Configure automatic definition updates, monitor update status via Defender for Cloud

control_mappings.azure_responsibility: Azure publishes security advisories via Service Health and Security Center
control_mappings.customer_responsibility: Customer monitors Azure security advisories and takes appropriate action
control_mappings.implementation_guidance: Subscribe to Azure Service Health alerts, monitor Defender for Cloud recommendations

notes: Azure Government provides strong platform-level security capabilities with shared responsibility for most controls. Customer must actively configure security features rather than relying on defaults.
